FuncDef:
The mpls te priority command configures the setup and holding priority values for an MPLS TE tunnel.
The undo mpls te priority command restores default priority values.
By default, both the setup and the holding priority values are 7.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the setup priority value.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 7. The smaller the value, the higher the priority.

Specifies the holding priority value.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 7. A holding priority value must be less than or equal to a setup priority value. The smaller the value, the higher the priority. The default value is the same as the configured setup priority value.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The setup priority of a tunnel must be no higher than its holding priority. This means a setup priority value must be greater than or equal to a holding priority value.
If resources are insufficient, setting the setup and holding priority values allows LSPs with lower priorities to release resources for establishing LSPs with higher priorities.
Bandwidth cannot be shared by tunnels with different priorities. If you configure make-before-break (MBB) first, tunnels cannot be established or preempt their own bandwidth resources. In this case, enable the break-before-make (BBM) capability for the tunnels.
